results.title: The Occupant
results.creator_credit: Michael Karris, Ettore Siracusa, Peter Lyssiotis and Masterthief Enterprises
results.brief_description: An experimental look at the migrant experience through the alienation of a Greek photographer. The photographer, Peter Lyssiotis, with memories of his homeland Cyprus, his relationship with his father and fantasies based in the photographer’s everyday life is well known for his work in photography, photomontage and photo books. He recently collaborated with Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karaglanidis on this film which explores some of the themes and practices of his photographic work.

results.title: The Objectives of criminal punishment
results.creator_credit: Peter Wiseman, Geoff Russell and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: What is the objective of criminal sanctions imposed on individuals found guilty of breaking the community’s laws? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal systemin balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. Explores and evaluates the goals of the criminal justice system: Community Protection, Reform, Rehabilitation, Deterrence, Retribution. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Oberon submarine
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Illustrates the Royal Australian Navy’s latest class of submarine. Four of these Oberon submarines are now in use and two others are to be built.

results.title: The Obedient flame
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, John Grierson and Science Film
results.brief_description: Charming promotional film extolling the virtues of gas cooking through a series of simple animations. Gender stereotypes are anachronistic, but innocent rather than patronising - intended audience was contemperaneous “housewives”. McLaren’s animations employ an economical graphic style strongly influenced by the art deco and industrial aesthetics of the day - as always, stiking and appealing. The last film Norman McLaren made in the United Kingdom.

results.title: The Oath and the man: a story of the French Revolution
results.brief_description: A tale of love and revenge set in Paris during the French Revolution. Cast includes Edward Dillon, Marion Leonard, Arthur V. Johnson, Florence Barker, Henry B. Walthall, Francis J. Grandon. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The OA
results.brief_description: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home seven years after going missing with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about where she’s been.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home to the community she grew up in with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about the seven years she went missing.
description_for_label: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home to the community she grew up in with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about the seven years she went missing.

results.title: The Nutty professor
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lewis, Ernest D Glucksman and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Professor Julius F. Kelp (Jerry Lewis), is a chemistry teacher in a large university. Tired of being pushed around and humiliated, he dedicates himself to finding a scientific solution to his problem and discovers a chemical formula that transforms him from a clumsy, shy weakling into an irresistable, dynamic individual, called Buddy Love. However the potion often wears off at inappropriate times with embarrassing and hilarious results. Julius finds himself juggling a hectic doublelife, meek chemistry professor by day, local celebrity and heart throb by night. Inevitably these two worlds collide. Written and directed by Jerry Lewis, this madcap comedy is a swinging combination of farce, slapstick and romance.

results.title: The Nutcracker prince
results.creator_credit: Paul Schibli, Kevin Gillis and Lacewood Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Megan Follows, Keifer Sutherland, Phyllis Diller and Peter O’Toole, and set to Tchaikovsky’s score, this is a story of magic, adventure and romance. When Clara finds a nutcracker in the form of a soldier boy under the Christmas tree, her uncle tells her the story of the Nutcracker Prince turned to wood by the evil Mousequeen. The young Prince can only reverse the spell by fighting the terrible Mouseking and winning the love of a beautiful maiden.

results.title: The Nutcracker (The Ballet)
results.brief_description: Mikhail Baryshnikov debuts his choreographic talent as well as dancing prowess in this timeless Hoffmann fairytale ballet. Performed by the American Ballet theatre to the classic Tschaikovsky score, “The Nutcracker” features Gelsey Kirkland as the young girl Clara, Baryshnikov as the Prince and Alexander Minz as Drosselmeyer, Clara’s godfather who conjures up an end to her dream. With the National Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Kenneth Schermerhorn.
